kooplearn.estimators module

kooplearn.estimators module¶

class kooplearn.estimators.LowRankRegressor¶

Bases: sklearn.base.BaseEstimator, sklearn.base.RegressorMixin

eig(left=False, right=True)¶

Eigenvalue decomposition of the estimated Koopman operator.

Parameters:

  • left (bool, optional) – Whether to return the left eigenfunctions. Defaults to False.

  • right (bool, optional) – Wheter to return the right eigenfunctions. Defaults to True.

Returns:

Eigenvalues of the estimated Koopman Operator. fr (lambda function, only if right=True): Right eigenfunctions of the estimated Koopman Operator. fl (lambda function, only if left=True): Left eigenfunctions of the estimated Koopman Operator.

Return type:

w (ndarray)

empirical_excess_risk(X, Y, norm='HS')¶
forecast(X, t=1.0, observable=<function LowRankRegressor.<lambda>>, which=None)¶

Forecast an observable using the estimated Koopman operator.

Parameters:

  • X (ndarray) – 2D array of shape (n_samples, n_features) containing the initial conditions.

  • t (scalar or ndarray, optional) – Time(s) to forecast. Defaults to 1.

  • observable (lambda function, optional) – Observable to forecast. Defaults to the identity map, corresponding to forecasting the state itself.

  • which (None or array of integers, optional) – If None, compute the forecast with all the modes of the observable. If which is an array of integers, the forecast is computed using only the modes corresponding to the indexes provided. The modes are arranged in decreasing order with respect to the eigenvalues. For example, if which = [0,2] only the first and third leading modes are used to forecast. Defaults to None.

  • method with t=1. (This) – x, and which = None is equivalent to self.predict(X).

  • = lambda x (observable) – x, and which = None is equivalent to self.predict(X).

  • aware of the unit of measurements (Be) – if the datapoints come from a continuous dynamical system disctretized every dt, the variable t in this function corresponds to the time t’ = t*dt of the continuous dynamical system.

Returns:

array of shape (n_t, n_samples, n_obs) containing the forecast of the observable(s) provided as argument. Here n_samples = len(X), n_obs = len(observable(x)), n_t = len(t) (if t is a scalar n_t = 1).

Return type:

ndarray

modes(observable=<function LowRankRegressor.<lambda>>, _cached_results=None)¶

Modes of the estimated Koopman operator.

Parameters:

  • observable (lambda function, optional) – _description_. Defaults to the identity map, corresponding to computing the modes of the state itself.

  • _modes_to_invert (ndarray, optional) – Internal parameter used if cached results can be exploited. Defaults to None.

Returns:

Array of shape (self.rank, n_obs) containing the estimated modes of the observable(s) provided as argument. Here n_obs = len(observable(x)).

Return type:

ndarray

norm()¶

Hilbert-Schmidt norm of the estimator ||hat{S}^{*}@U@V.T@hat{Z}||_{HS} = n^{-2}tr(U.T@K_X@U@V.T@K_Y@V)

predict(X)¶

Predict the state of the system at the next step using the estimated Koopman operator. :param X: Array of shape (n_samples, n_features) containing n_samples states of the system. :type X: ndarray

Returns:

Array of shape (n_samples, n_features) containing the one-step-ahead prediction of the states in X.

Return type:

ndarray

reconstruction_error(X, Y)¶
risk(X=None, Y=None)¶

Empirical risk of the model. \(\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i = 1}^{n} ||\phi(Y_i) - G^*\phi(X_i)||^{2}_{\mathcal{H}}\)

Parameters:

  • X (ndarray, optional) – Array of shape (num_test_points, num_features) of input observations. Defaults to None.

  • Y (ndarray, optional) – Array of shape (num_test_points, num_features) of evolved observations. Defaults to None.

  • X == Y == None (If) –

  • traning data is used. And the sample training risk is returned. (the) –

Returns:

Risk of the Low Rank Regression estimator.

Return type:

float

svals(k=6, stabilizer=None)¶

Compute the largest singular values of Z = AS (A = Koopman operator, S = injection operator)

Parameters:

  • k (int, optional) – Number of singular values to evaluate. Defaults to 6.

  • stabilizer ([float, None], optional) – A float to stabilize the inversion of K_x. It amounts to replaxe K_x -> K_x + stabilizer*Id. Defaults to None, corresponding to the pre-specified Tikhonov regularization in the RRR algorithm and to sqrt(num_points)^-1 in the PCR algorithm.

Returns:

Array of the computed singular values decreasingly ordered.

Return type:

NDArray
